intro: Parietaria populifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf wall-rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded areas such as woodland edges and streambanks. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which can cause skin irritation in some individuals. Parietaria populifolia is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
